text: Genes that regulate <extra_id_0> interleukin-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in T cells .
<extra_id_0> Interleukin-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an immunomodulatory cytokine which plays a central role in the regulation of allergic and atopic immune responses .
Significant progress has been made in gaining a detailed understanding of the transcriptional regulation of the <extra_id_0> interleukin-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
The recent identification and characterization of several key transcription factors has helped to elucidate the molecular mechanisms of T helper cell cytokine gene expression .
